init.help: Initializes git-castle for your current repository.

add-user.help: Adds a user to the trusted set of users that can decrypt secrets in this repository.

parameters.help: Username of the user on this machine. If you use multiple machines, you can create a dummy username (e.g. ajaymerchia.mac & ajaymerchia.pc)
Filepath to the RSA public key for this user.

login.help: Switch your repository-level profile to an identity stored in your ~/.git-castle directory.

parameters.help: Username of the profile on this machine you wish to switch to. Must be pre-existing.

keygen.help: Generate your public & private RSA keys to share with a repository owner.

parameters.help: Username of the profile on this machine you wish to switch to. Must be pre-existing.
Outfile for your RSA public key. This is what you will share with others.

guard.help: Marks a file for encryption before committing. Make sure that the file is in your .gitignore. To remove from git-castle, delete it from the .git-castle-secrets file.

lockdown.help: Encrypts all secrets in your repository.

reveal.help: Decrypts all secrets in your repository.

hook.help: Adds git-castle to your pre-commit hook.
